key_mistakes.reason: Delays development and weakens the king's pawn structure.
Neglects central control and allows Black to gain momentum.
A passive move that fails to challenge White's center.
Blocks the bishop and misses better developing moves.
Passively places the bishop without any immediate threat.
Misses the opportunity to castle and secure the king.
Overextends the rook, leaving it vulnerable.
Creates weaknesses and opens lines for White's attack.

recommendations: Focus on developing all pieces early in the opening.
Prioritize king safety by castling at the appropriate time.
Avoid unnecessary pawn moves that weaken the structure.
Seek active and harmonious placement of pieces to control the board.
